label: 末法
本: Capital and Countryside in Japan, 300-1180:  Japanese Historians Interpreted in English . Cornell University East Asia Program . 2006
説明文: “the latter days of the Buddhist law,” the idea that at a certain point after the lifetime of the Buddha—for some in Japan, after the year 1052—the world would enter into a period of great lawlessness and violence when the Buddha’s teachings would become increasingly difficult to teach and follow.
